stream_context.summary: Kaze focuses on asset-building for the new craft-themed Course 14 and performance/visual polish for the nearly finished Course 13. He tests frame-rate, tweaks clouds, experiments with lighting (desk-lamp skybox), lays out star concepts, talks ROM size, engine optimisations and outlines a staged release plan while coordinating with Zeina and Biobak.

development_findings.summary: Course 13 is functionally complete; only the exterior area remains for Zeina to finish.
development_findings.quote: 13 is mostly done now. The outside area still needs some work, but Zeina's working on that.

development_findings.summary: Course 14’s entire gimmick is ‘craft materials’: cardboard terrain, crayons, plastic cups, pins, toothpicks, pipe cleaners, desk-lamp sun, etc.
development_findings.quote: This is the craft level. It's made out of craft materials, the whole thing.

development_findings.summary: Five of six star ideas were verbally drafted, including a crayon-drawing puzzle where Mario carries a yellow crayon to ‘draw’ a star for Luigi.
development_findings.quote: You bring him a yellow crayon, you carry it like this, and while you walk on the paper, you draw on the paper. So you draw a star on the paper and you get a star for it.

development_findings.summary: Mirror-Mario boss set-piece added to Course 13; Kaze considers the movement ‘genuinely so fun’.
development_findings.quote: You fight Mirror Mario by kicking up here. Isn't that cool?

development_findings.summary: ROM is capped at 64 MB; current build tests at ~30 FPS on real hardware, with simple cloud-density toggles for extra headroom.
development_findings.quote: I want at least 30 FPS… I can very easily increase the FPS by just reducing the amount of clouds.

development_findings.summary: Imported Nintendo’s F3DX3 microcode to gain further rendering efficiency.
Engine off-loads costly math (e.g., sine/cosine) to CPU where possible to save RSP cycles.
development_findings.quote: The example I gave—the sine and cosine function—that's a very good thing to offload to the CPU.

development_findings.summary: Biobak trimmed ~400 polygons by swapping out tree models in Course 13’s boss area.
development_findings.quote: How the fuck did he kill 400 polygons? … Removed the trees around the area.

development_findings.summary: Planned release cadence: v1.0 (runs on both N64 & emu), v1.1 (same), v1.2 (N64 only, forcing emulator devs to catch up).
development_findings.quote: 1.2 is only N64… emulators will then technologically have to catch up with the game.

development_findings.summary: Overall ROM builds are tested directly on console; shading bug and hall-of-mirrors artefact noted for later fix.
development_findings.quote: There looks to be some sort of shading bug though.

context_findings.summary: Kaze dislikes ads but will accept a Raid Shadow Legends deal only to ‘mess with them’; used ChatGPT to auto-negotiate the email.
context_findings.quote: I legit just went to ChatGPT and told it make me as much money as possible… Hopefully it works out.

context_findings.summary: Parents visited for 10 days, forcing him into yard work; he feels tanned but lost dev time.
context_findings.quote: I spent so much time outside this week and I hated it.

context_findings.summary: Lives in Canada (permanent resident, working toward citizenship); openly critical of German taxes/bureaucracy.
context_findings.quote: I've been living in Canada for 3 years now, I'm still being haunted by German bureaucracy.

context_findings.summary: Work-out habit begun to improve reaction time for competitive gaming; frames himself as balancing physical and mental fitness.
context_findings.quote: If you want a healthy mind, you kind of need a healthy body.

context_findings.summary: Personal life: married to Zeina; newborn daughter ‘Reina’ is seven weeks old.
context_findings.quote: I became a father seven weeks and six days ago. Her name is Reina.

biobak.summary: Removed ~400 polygons (mainly trees) in Course 13 boss area, promising a lower-poly replacement.
biobak.quote: Removed the trees around the area… I have a better replacement.

biobak.summary: Will texture-pass Course 14 once Kaze finishes grey-box assets; granted an optional ‘day off’.
biobak.quote: I’ve given Biobak the day off… although I think the art is definitely gonna work right.

zeina.summary: Finalising exterior of Course 13 and provided physics play-testing feedback.
zeina.quote: I had Zeina test it, and she managed to move pretty well with these physics.

zeina.summary: Sketching concepts for the overworld (Yoshi’s Fruit Islands) and broader visual cohesion.
zeina.quote: Zeina was already doing sketches though; she wanted to make the overworld.

key_stories.title: Clouds vs Frame-Rate
key_stories.summary: While demoing Course 13, Kaze noticed frame drops to 25 FPS. He isolated dense cloud geometry as the culprit and confirmed reducing cloud count instantly restores speed.
key_stories.challenge: Maintain 30 FPS on real N64 hardware.
key_stories.process: Adjusted cloud density variable in real time (e.g., set to 0.5).
key_stories.outcome: Stable 30 FPS achievable without visible design loss.
key_stories.key_quote: I can very easily increase the FPS by just reducing the amount of clouds.

key_stories.title: AI-Written Sponsorship Email
key_stories.summary: Kaze wants a Raid Shadow Legends sponsorship solely to satirise ads. He asked ChatGPT to ‘make me as much money as possible’ and sent the generated text without reading.
key_stories.challenge: Negotiate a sponsorship while minimising personal effort.
key_stories.process: Used ChatGPT to draft and send email; plans comedic 4-hour ‘visible walls’ video.
key_stories.outcome: Awaiting Raid’s response; illustrates Kaze’s anti-ad stance and playful subversion.
key_stories.key_quote: I didn't even read this. I just said send.

key_stories.title: Star Drawing Puzzle
key_stories.summary: Designing Course 14’s third star: Luigi doodle wants a yellow crayon; player carries crayon, traces outline on paper, star appears.
key_stories.challenge: Create an interactive craft-themed puzzle that feels intuitive.
key_stories.process: Outlined mechanics in stream; will add trace outline to guide players.
key_stories.key_quote: You draw a star on the paper and you get a star for it.

key_stories.title: Mirror Mario Boss Concept
key_stories.summary: Added a mirrored slope arena where Mario fights a reflection by jump-kicking walls.
key_stories.challenge: Deliver a memorable Course 13 climax that exploits new movement physics.
key_stories.process: Built new geometry and tested with Zeina.
key_stories.outcome: Declared ‘coolest section ever’; ready for polish.
key_stories.key_quote: The movement in this is genuinely so fun.

key_stories.title: Tree Poly-Count Reduction
key_stories.summary: Biobak noticed high-poly trees hurting performance and silently replaced them.
key_stories.process: Deleted original trees, substituted lower-poly models, saving ~400 triangles.
key_stories.outcome: Performance headroom gained without aesthetic loss.
key_stories.key_quote: How the fuck did he kill 400 polygons?

open_questions.context: Kaze said the team ‘imported F3DX3’ but gave no details.
questions: What concrete performance gains has F3DX3 provided?
Were any rendering features sacrificed or added?
Who led the integration and how long did it take?

open_questions.context: Kaze noted Sauraen is ‘working on it’ to push the RSP.
questions: What specific bottlenecks are being addressed?
What new microcodes or tools are in development?
How will this affect level complexity going forward?

open_questions.context: No mention of current soundtrack progress.
questions: What stage is Badub at with the OST?
How is the craft theme influencing musical direction?
Are there any technical constraints for streamed vs. sequenced music?

open_questions.context: Zeina is sketching ‘Yoshi’s Fruit Islands’, but no specifics shared.
questions: What is the overworld’s structure and narrative purpose?
How do unlocks, NPC hubs, or shortcuts function?
What visual tone is Zeina aiming for?

open_questions.context: Versioning plan outlined but no dates.
questions: Projected dates for v1.0, v1.1, v1.2?
How will testing on real hardware be handled?
Will public demos precede full release?

open_questions.context: Stream shows informal coordination but lacks structured process.
questions: How does the team track tasks and milestones?
Are there scheduled stand-ups or code reviews?
How are art assets handed off between Kaze and Biobak?
